cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of supervised topic modeling, which involves simultaneously modeling the latent topic structure of large collections of documents and a response variable associated with each document. This problem is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), natural language processing (cs.CL), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), information retrieval (cs.IR), and social and information networks (cs.SI). Given that the paper proposes a novel spectral learning algorithm for supervised topic modeling, it is likely to be of interest to researchers working in these sub-fields.
